Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label at least two different habitats, one on land and one in water (e.g., forest and pond).
The student can illustrate and label a variety of plants found in each habitat, such as trees and grasses in a land habitat, and water plants in a water habitat.
The student can illustrate and label a variety of animals from each habitat, like lizards and squirrels in the land habitat, and fish or clams in the water habitat.
The student can compare the different types of living things found in each habitat through their drawing to show plant and animal diversity.
The student can identify patterns in the natural world by using their drawing to show how different habitats can house different communities of living things.
